intro: Manettia uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters, often in shades of white or pink. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Manettia uniflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
